basisSet.dc:title: 6-311G**
basisSet.dct:abstract: VTZP Valence Triple Zeta + Polarization on All Atoms
basisSet.dc:description:
6-311G** Valence Triple Zeta + Polarization Basis ------------------------------------------------- Elements Contraction Reference H - He: (5s,1p) -> [3s,1p] R. Krishnan, J.S. Binkley, R. Seeger and Li - Ne: (11s,5p,1d) -> [4s,3p,1d] J.A. Pople, J. Chem. Phys. 72, 650 (1980). K - Ca: (14s,11p,4d)-> [8s,7p,2d] J-P. Blaudeau, M. P. McGrath, L.A. Curtiss and L. Radom, J. Chem. Phys. 107, 5016 (1997). Ga - Kr: (14,12p,6d) -> [8s,7p,3d] L. A. Curtiss, M. P. McGrath, J-P. Blaudeau, N. E. Davis, R. C. Binning, Jr., L. Radom, J. Chem. Phys. 103, 6104 (1995). I : (15s,12p,6d)-> [10s,9p,4d] M.N. Glukhovtsev, A. Pross, M.P. McGrath and L. Radom, J. Chem. Phys. 103, 1878 (1995).
This basis has increased flexibility in the valence region relative to the 6-31G basis because it uses three functions to represent each valence AO. Note: This basis uses 5-component d functions.
